81.speaker: Player
81.text: I feel more powerful than ever.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I feel more powerful than ever.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I saved the world. The sacrifice was worth it.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: We wouldn't have succeeded without your guidance.

66.speaker: The Emperor
66.text: You made your own choices. I merely nudged you in the direction that would result in our greatest chance of success.

11.speaker: The Emperor
11.text: For what it's worth, I think you are much improved now.

55.speaker: The Emperor
55.text: I may not be able to read your thoughts anymore, but I'm certain I know them -

106.speaker: The Emperor
106.text: No doubt you will use them to summon the Crown. But what then? What will you do when such power is in your grasp?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I will reforge the Crown and become a god.

58.speaker: The Emperor
58.text: I must confess, I admire your ambition almost as much as I fear its consequences.

45.speaker: The Emperor
45.text: A word of advice - keep the stones close to you. For as we have seen, even a Netherbrain can be dominated.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I will deliver the Crown to Mystra, to ensure that none may access such power again.

115.speaker: The Emperor
115.text: A wise decision, and a humble one.

7.speaker: The Emperor
7.text: Perhaps Mystra will even see fit to forgive you for making such a choice, and cure you of the orb.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I will deliver the Crown to Mystra - it will be safer in her hands than in the hands of mortals.

96.speaker: The Emperor
96.text: You hold her opinion above mine still? In spite of all she's done to you?

33.speaker: The Emperor
33.text: Then for your sake I hope she shows you mercy. Or that you do to her.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I'll leave the Crown where it is. So long as it's separated from the stones, no one will ever wield its power again.

94.speaker: The Emperor
94.text: Then keep the stones close. There will be those who seek to take them from you. To stake their claim on power, even though you do not.

19.speaker: The Emperor
19.text: I wish you well, Gale of Waterdeep, for the fate of our world will depend on their failure to find you, or your success in defeating them when they do.

101.speaker: The Emperor
101.text: You're wondering what became of the Netherstones.

39.speaker: The Emperor
39.text: They're lost to the Chionthar, with the Crown. Neither you nor anyone else will ever wield them again.

60.speaker: The Emperor
60.text: So what will you do now, Gale of Waterdeep?

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *The orb pulses within you still - Elminster's magic is all that keeps it contained. As long as the magic remains, so do you.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *But the orb is not your only concern.*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Whatever time is left is yours and yours alone.*

37.speaker: Player
37.text: It's time I return to my books - they've been piling up, unread for too long.

27.speaker: The Emperor
27.text: The expansion of one's mind with the intellect of others' is never a bad idea.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I must seek Elminster's counsel - I must find a way to stabilise the orb for good.

0.speaker: The Emperor
0.text: No doubt the Old Mage will have much to say about your adventures, and you will have much to tell him.

48.speaker: The Emperor
48.text: I wish you well in this.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: There are so many worlds I'm yet to see, and not much time to see them. I feel my next adventure calling.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Our achievements must not be lost to posterity. I shall write this tale that all may learn from it.

117.speaker: The Emperor
117.text: I trust you will enjoy the process, for few will believe the stories you have to tell.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *The threat of the Grand Design is over, but your people will never accept you back into their embrace.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *What happens next will be by your design, and yours alone.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: We should stay in the city. Help to rebuild it.

24.speaker: The Emperor
24.text: But I would not recommend it. The city does not welcome the likes of us, at least not on its surface.

22.speaker: The Emperor
22.text: I will do what I have always done. I will survive.

110.speaker: The Emperor
110.text: This is my city. It needs authority.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Then this is where we part ways?

77.speaker: The Emperor
77.text: Strange, isn't it? To have travelled this far, inseparable from one another, only to cut the cord at the final step.

30.speaker: The Emperor
30.text: You have become... important to me.

105.speaker: The Emperor
105.text: And should our paths ever cross again, I will be glad to see you.

34.text: But I will not be joining you. The city has no love for the likes of me.

31.speaker: The Emperor
31.text: But I will not be joining you. The city has no love for the likes of me.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Let's get out of this godsforsaken city. I hear Amn is lovely this time of year.

71.speaker: The Emperor
71.text: Not a bad idea - it will certainly be safer than staying in the city.

50.speaker: The Emperor
50.text: But I will not be joining you.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I think it's time we part ways.

88.speaker: The Emperor
88.text: Battle forms comrades of the coldest souls, but it seems that yours is determined to stay frozen.

32.speaker: The Emperor
32.text: Very well. Then I bid you farewell. And... good luck.

42.speaker: The Emperor
42.text: May your path ahead lead you to the allies you desire.

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have failed your queen.*

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Return to the city. My home.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Return to the city. My home.

46.speaker: The Emperor
46.text: You've earned a triumphant homecoming. Though you may find your instincts are somewhat changed - and people will treat you... unkindly.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'm not sure. This is all very new.

28.speaker: The Emperor
28.text: Embrace your evolution. You are more than you've ever been. All that has changed in you has changed for the better.

8.speaker: The Emperor
8.text: If you do intend to stay in the city, the Undercellar may offer a suitable refuge while you learn how to hide in plain sight, as I once did.

119.speaker: The Emperor
119.text: Well-deserved. You will find your dreams much changed, full of colours and shapes you do not yet recognise. But you will know them, in time.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'm not ready. It isn't fair.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *One last look to remember. One last look to say goodbye.*

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Live a good life, will you? Make it worthwhile.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I did what I had to do.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I never trusted you - you were just my best chance of survival.

112.speaker: The Emperor
112.text: It's a shame - with an attitude like that, you would have made a wonderful illithid.

107.speaker: The Emperor
107.text: And that is why we succeeded.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm still angry that you manipulated me.

64.speaker: The Emperor
64.text: I really thought at this point that you might have let go of that...

63.speaker: The Emperor
63.text: But it matters not. We succeeded.
